msContents.summary: This incomplete palm-leaf manuscript from the twelfth century is among the earliest ones preserving the Sādhanamālā, an extensive collection of rituals dedicated to various divinities of the Buddhist pantheon. It is one of the eight codices used by B. Bhattacharya for the editio princeps of this text published in 1925-1928.

msItem.title: Sādhanamālā
msItem.incipit: [43r1] śūlaṃ vāmapārśve padmasthakapālaṃ [sādhana no. 27 in the edition]
msItem.explicit: [152v6] śikhāyāṃ phaṭ_ phaṭ_ caṇḍikā sarvāṅge [sādhana no. 226 in the edition]

supportDesc.foliation: Nepālākṣara numearls or letter numerals, mid-left margin, verso. Two sets: first set runs ff. 43-58, second set runs ff. 34-152 (folio 58 of the first set is the same as folio 34 of the second one; cf. Bendall 1883: 174)
Arabic numerals, near the stringhole, verso, pencil, modern.
supportDesc.condition: Incomplete, in good condition. The margins of some folios are slightly damaged, but the text is still readable. Rare retracings.

layout.p: 6 lines per page, approximately 48 akṣaras per line.
layout.stringHole: One string hole in the middle of a blank column-like space. 2

bindingDesc.p: On the inside of the front cover, the writing: $ thva postaka sādhanamālā ||.
On both the inside of the front cover and the inside of the back cover, some writing in a whitish ink.

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1873-6.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
